basics.name: Alana Wesly
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences and a B.A in Dance in the Department of Theatre and Dance at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring 2028.

work.summary: Conversation partner for English learning exhange students
highlights: Facilitated and encouraged foreign exchange students to speak conversational English by working through assignment questions in groups of two to five students
Evaluated session outcomes for students and myself after every session

work.summary: Researched with data visualization for the Cyberinfrastructure Training For Undergraduates In Summer (CITRUS) program
highlights: Completed a research project analyzing bird population change over time in Hawaii, using Python and the Pandas, NumPy, and Seaborn libraries to manipulate csv data and create data visualizations of birds sighted by year, species, and geographical origin
Developed data science skills in Python through the completion of DataCamp courses

work.company: Applied Research Laboratory at the University of Hawaii
highlights: Researched and tested Azure Document Intelligence Studio for the creation of an AI model to differentiate between Certified Unclassified Information (CUI) and non-CUI documents, presentations, flyers, and more
Assisted set up, use of, and clean up of research materials in the field at Sand Island

volunteer.organization: Association for Computing Machinery at UH Manoa
volunteer.summary: Assisted club members in receiving reimbursements for club purchases
highlights: Managed monetary reimbursements of purchases for ACM clubs and events through communication with purchasers and reimbursers, and maintaining organized records

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Recognition of academic achivement by 3.5 GPA or higher.

awards.title: Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Valedictorian
awards.summary: State of Hawaii DOE acknowledges valedictorian status to graduating high school seniors who have at least a 4.0 weighted GPA, and have taken two or more college level (AP and or early college) classes.
